intro: Marcgravia leticiana, commonly known as the Leticiana starr. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae, native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its striking, large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter. It produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds. Marcgravia leticiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to humid, shaded environments.
